| A Plumach Rilmani:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* has a [thick hide](/wiki/Thick-skinned "Thick-skinned").
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* cannot be [tamed](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming"). |                                                                                                                                                   |

### Equipment sets

Plumach equipment is made of non-rustable [metal](/wiki/Metal "Metal").

#### Militia

1⁄3 of Plumachs are **militia members**.

- −1 uncursed metallic [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword")
- One out of 3 milita members will have a +0 uncursed [kite shield](/index.php?title=Kite_shield\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Kite shield (page does not exist)")

#### Civilian

The remaining 2⁄3 of Plumachs are **civilians**.

- −1 uncursed metallic [sickle](/index.php?title=Sickle\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Sickle (page does not exist)"), [scythe](/wiki/Scythe "Scythe"), or [axe](/wiki/Axe "Axe")

### Spells

Plumachs will cast the [solid fog](/index.php?title=Solid_fog\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Solid fog (page does not exist)") monster spell. Creatures in the fog have their speed reduced by 2⁄3. When a Plumach casts solid fog, it becomes [canceled](/wiki/Cancellation "Cancellation").

### Sneak attack

When attacking an incapacitated target, or one which cannot see or sense them, Cuprilaches receive bonus damage on their melee attacks equal to 1 to 1.5 times their level (so 1 to 12 for a level 8 Cuprilach).

## Encyclopedia entry

To paraphrase a particularly wise prime, the rilmani are an  
enigma cloaked in a riddle, wrapped in a mystery. Who can  
question their motives or their actions? They keep their own  
counsel. They're sworn never to come when called, but always  
to be there when needed; never to answer questions put to  
them, but always to provide what information is necessary; to  
aid and abet good, evil, law, and chaos alike in order to maintain  
the Balance, regardless of the cost or repercussions.
